column3: > Fix that by resetting the global arg for each test suite. Note that this wont reset the arg between test cases, as the constructor/destructor is not called for them.\n\nCould clarify in OP or title that this is not a general fix? In other words it applies only to `-segwitheight` specifically, right? :)

To catch similar cases going forward: perhaps we could run `src/test/test_bitcoin` as a single process in one Travis job?

That way we could also catch cases where `src/test/test_bitcoin` prints error messages which was the case previously.

Let me know if such a Travis job would be accepted: if so I can implement.
> That way we could also catch cases where src/test/test_bitcoin prints error messages which was the case previously.\n\nWhat "error messages" and "previously" are you referring to?
> What "error messages" and "previously" are you referring to?\n\nSorry, context here: #15352, #15944, #16277 :)
ACK fa07b8beb598642655b1207afd275b801ff8cec2, I also tested that this fixes the issue in #15845.
> Let me know if such a Travis job would be accepted: if so I can implement.\n\nNo opinion from me
